intro: Didymoglossum henzaianum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bog moss, is a small, evergreen moss that thrives in wet, acidic environments such as bogs and fens. It belongs to the family Dicranaceae and is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves that are often curved or rolled. The plant forms dense, cushion-like mats and has a low profile, making it well adapted to its moist, often nutrient-poor habitats. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stems and release spores when mature. This species is an important component of peatland ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and carbon sequestration.
